title: Semiconductor overview in India 2023
selftext:
1. Micron Tech beings construction of $2.75 billion chip packaging plant in Gujarat.
2. Foxconn submits application for setting up semiconductor fabrication unit in India and had expressed interest earlier to set up 4-5 fabs in India
3. Foxconn is also in talks with Taiwan's chip-making giant Taiwan Semiconductor  Manufacturing Co (TSMC) and Japan's TMH Group for a joint venture and  technology partnership to start semiconductor fab
4. AMD unveiled a huge campus in Bengaluru, focused on the design and development of semiconductor technology.
5. Israel's Tower semiconductor has submitted a second bid to enter India with a Fabrication unit for 65nm and 45nm after Intel had earlier failed to buy it
6. Kaynes semicon has announced a investment of 2,850 crore in a facility in Hyderabad for OSAT.
7. Tata to invest Rs 200 crore to set up semiconductor unit in Karnataka
8. HCL inching close to chip unit in Karnataka, investment estimated at $400 million

As of the end of October 2023, the government has received a total of 45 applications  under its INR 760 billion semiconductor and display manufacturing  scheme. These applications cover five requests for the establishment of  semiconductor fabs, two for display fabs, nine for the setup of compound  and ATMP facilities, and 29 for the design-linked incentive scheme. \[9\]

Sources: [\[1\]](https://www.hindustantimes.com/business/micron-begins-construction-of-2-75-billion-semiconductor-plant-in-gujarat-101695478422567.html) [\[2a\]](https://www.businesstoday.in/technology/news/story/apple-iphone-maker-foxconn-submits-application-for-setting-up-semiconductor-fabrication-unit-in-india-410416-2023-12-21) [\[2b\]](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/foxconn-looking-to-set-up-4-5-semiconductor-fabrication-lines-in-india/articleshow/101684279.cms?from=mdr) [\[3\]](https://www.business-standard.com/companies/news/foxconn-in-talks-with-tsmc-tmh-group-to-make-chips-in-india-report-123071400154_1.html) [\[4\]](https://www.businesstoday.in/technology/news/story/amd-to-invest-400-million-in-india-to-set-up-largest-design-center-in-bengaluru-391646-2023-07-28) [\[5\]](https://m.economictimes.com/tech/technology/israels-chipmaker-tower-resubmits-proposal-to-set-up-65-nm-40-nm-chip-fab/amp_articleshow/106254844.cms) [\[6\]](https://www.thehindu.com/news/cities/Hyderabad/kaynes-tech-chooses-telangana-for-2800-crore-semiconductor-oast-facility/article67389308.ece) [\[7\]](http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/articleshow/103723629.cms?utm_source=contentofinterest&utm_medium=text&utm_campaign=cppst) [\[8\]](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/tech/technology/hcl-inching-close-to-chip-unit-in-karnataka-investment-estimated-at-400-million/articleshow/105602078.cms) [\[9\]](https://www.entrepreneur.com/en-in/technology/the-semiconductor-fomo/466368)

You are forgetting lower end AI chips that will be used in efficient manufacturing, robotics and all sorts of things.

[https://kinara.ai/products/kinara-ara-2/](https://kinara.ai/products/kinara-ara-2/)

This is one of them. Another one is MDS. There are like so many startups which are doing it, it will revolutionize robotics after a few years and precision engineering will improve quite a lot in India. India has to increase incentives for private investment and formulate laws around proprietary tech, because of the lackluster legal ecosystem companies are registering themselves abroad instead of the nation.

The chip is manufactured by [TSMCâ€™s 28nm](https://www.google.ae/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=&ved=2ahUKEwj4qLmKtrqDAxUn7gIHHSBZBgIQFnoECBQQAQ&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eenewseurope.com%2Fen%2Fchip-industry-veteran-segers-joins-edge-ai-firm-kinara%2F&usg=AOvVaw2GBnk-VYaC8BJQBkPdIQlk&opi=89978449) which is not in india
So? It's designed in India. Half of the things you have mentioned are design houses anyway. And both Foxconn deals were cancelled

Nope, I only made 1 point for design because they were investing $400 million towards it . Point 3 had no updates and point 2 still stands. The previous foxconn-Vedanta bid was cancelled, this is the second bid without it

I can also add that point that they designed AI chips though

Yeah a semiconductor plant means anything from displays, SSDs, DRAMs, ICs to MPs & MCs etc. I literally work in the robotics field, we design certain systems that uses these things. 

They designed 16 nm MPs that can run ML and AI workloads effectively for lower cost uses like security cameras, IoT etc, that is where a lot of money is, small things but they need to make a whole ecosystem to go along with it that would require scaling up which they likely won't be able to do in india for now lets see.

I am not confused, actual chip production will be select few, most high end ones that are coming will be design houses rest will manufacture older tech like you mentioned 65nm.

But this is how you enter the market, the pay in the industry outside of a select few jobs isn't as good and its a tough industry to go into as a result hard to attract top talent. Actually in house design and manufacturing will take at least a decade now it will mostly be testing and assembly. If India has rare earth minerals then they should mine those too to add more value to the market.

Oh its new year already there, Happy New Year.
